Title:
Periconia citlaltepetlensis sp. nov. (Periconiaceae,
Pleosporales): a psychrotolerant fungus from high elevation volcanic
glacier (Mexico)
Keywords:
Dothideomycetes, phylogeny, taxonomy, tropical ice
samples
Abstract:
Periconia citlaltepetlensis sp. nov. is the first record
of a fungus identified to species level from high elevation volcanic
glacier in Mexico. It is a novel dothideomycete species supported by
morphological, cultural characters and phylogenetic analysis (nucleotide
sequences data rDNA analysis). The new species is characterized by
conidiophores often with 2Â–4 enteroblastic, percurrent proliferations,
large, globose, golden brown or reddish brown conidia that are borne
singly or in basipetal chains, verrucose to irregular lobate crests,
born singly or in basipetal chains of two conidia; acropetally
proliferating; conidiogenesis holoblastic. The morphology of P.
citlaltepetlensis is compared to other Periconia species and a detailed
description and morphological illustrations are provided.
